Dermot O'Leary has won over The Nightly Show viewers in his second night in the hosting seat, with some even asking for him to present every week. 
The X Factor presenter showed his natural presenting skills as he viewers enjoyed his hilarious antics. 
It was initially feared he was as unpopular as his predecessors as viewers slammed him for being "boring" after his first night as host. 
But fans of the late-night chat show have warmed to Dermot as he improved his performance with more confidence and funnier jokes. Read More Viewers have warmed to Dermot The X Factor host turned on the charm (Photo: ITV) Dermot was joined by comedians Vic Reeves and Bob Mortimer, as he challenged them to a sing off. 
While he won't be getting through to Boot Camp on the X Factor, the host will certainly be getting more fans on his side. 
The Nightly Show has struggled to win over viewers as it enters its fourth week, with previous hosts including David Walliams and John Bishop receiving criticism. Vic and Bob were tonight's guests (Photo: ITV) Even Dermot grabbed the mic (Photo: ITV) Read More Davina McCall fakes ORGASM live on The Nightly Show and blames 'dirty hackers' 
Viewers of the chat show took to Twitter to praise the host for a much better second show. 
One viewer said: " #thenightlyshow should be changed to the Dermot O'Leary Show. He's been the best host so far! U could replace Johnathan Ross!!" 
Another added: "That's how you save the @ITVNightlyShow give it to @radioleary all the time!!" Viewers were impressed by Dermot tonight (Photo: ITV) 
A third said: " #thenightlyshow Great Show! @radioleary certainly jumping the shark or whatever the saying is? 10/10" 
A fourth agreed: "Actually quite enjoying #thenightlyshow @radioleary is quite a natural interviewer unlike previous hosts." 
* The Nightly Show airs weeknights at 10.00pm on ITV. Like us on Facebook
